unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Binomial Calculations: Tossing a Fair Coin
question_text: Suppose a fair coin is tossed $8\text{ times}$ , and only $2$ of those $\text{tosses}$ were heads. Use binomial calculations to determine the probability of $2$ or fewer heads out of $8\text{ tosses}$ , and determine if this gives appropriate evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair.

choices.text: P ( 2 or fewer heads ) = 0.304 P ( 2 or fewer heads ) = 0.304 Yes, this gives enough evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair
P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.304 P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.304 No, this does not give enough evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair
P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.1094 P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.1094 No, this does not give enough evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair
P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.1445 P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.1445 No, this does not give enough evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair
P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.0245 P ( 2 heads or fewer ) = 0.0245 .   Yes, this gives enough evidence to suggest that the coin is unfair
